properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 2:49AM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20
inches. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph near Weed, CA and
high exposed terrain in the Shasta Valley.

* WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County. This includes most of
Interstate 5 south of Weed and all of Highway 89 in Siskiyou
County. It also includes Mt. Shasta City, Mt Shasta Ski Park,
Dunsmuir, Snowman's Summit, and McCloud.

* WHEN...From 4 PM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact morning or evening travel.
Strong winds could cause tree damage.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take
protective action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY
